[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::sign_share()] [High - Message Size] Is there a maximum message size enforced to prevent DoS through large message processing?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::verify()] [High - Signature Size] Is the sum parameter validated to be non-zero and within the scalar field order?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::process_addendum()] [High - Participant Validation] Is the participant index l validated to be within the valid range [1, n]?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::verify_share()] [High - Verification Share] Is verification_share validated to be a non-identity point on the curve?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: IetfTranscript::append_message()] [Medium - Message Length] Can extremely large messages cause memory exhaustion when appended to the transcript?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Trait: Algorithm] [High - Curve Binding] Is the curve identifier bound to the transcript to prevent cross-curve attacks using the same keys?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Struct: IetfTranscript] [High - Protocol Binding] Without domain separation, can IETF transcripts collide across different protocols (Bitcoin, Ethereum, Monero)?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::sign_share()] [Medium - Network Binding] Is the network identifier (Bitcoin/ETH/XMR) bound to the challenge to prevent cross-network signature reuse?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Type: IetfSchnorr] [Medium - Offset Warning] The warning about key offsets breaking compatibility - can this be exploited if offsets are used despite the warning?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Struct: Schnorr] [Critical - State Lifecycle] The challenge self.c has states (None, Some) - can the state machine be bypassed to call verify() with stale or wrong challenges?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::sign_share()] [High - Multiple Calls] Can sign_share() be called multiple times on the same instance, overwriting self.c and invalidating pending verifications?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::verify()] [High - Multiple Verifications] Can verify() be called multiple times with the same self.c but different group_key/nonces/sum, enabling signature malleability?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Trait: Algorithm] [Medium - Stateless Design] Should Algorithm implementations be stateless to prevent state confusion attacks?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::sign_share()] [Medium - Field Arithmetic] Can scalar field operations overflow or underflow, producing incorrect signature shares?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::verify()] [Medium - Point Arithmetic] Can group operations cause exceptions or return invalid points on curve implementation errors?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: IetfTranscript::append_message()] [Medium - Vector Growth] Can unbounded vector growth cause integer overflow in length calculations?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::sign_share()] [High - Timestamp Binding] Is a timestamp or nonce bound to the signature to prevent replay of valid signatures in different contexts?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::verify()] [Medium - Signature Freshness] Can old valid signatures be replayed in new contexts where they shouldn't be valid?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::process_addendum()] [Medium - Addendum Freshness] Can stale addendums from old sessions be replayed to cause verification failures?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Type: IetfSchnorr] [High - IETF Compliance] Does the IetfSchnorr implementation strictly follow the FROST IETF draft? Can deviations cause interoperability failures?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Struct: IetfTranscript] [Medium - Serialization Format] Does IetfTranscript use a standard serialization format compatible with other FROST implementations?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Hram::hram()] [Medium - Hash Function] Is the hash function used in H::hram() standardized (SHA256, SHA512) for interoperability?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::process_addendum()] [High - Byzantine Addendum] Can a Byzantine validator send malicious addendums that cause honest validators to crash or produce invalid shares?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::verify_share()] [High - Byzantine Share] Can Byzantine validators send malformed shares that cause verify_share() to panic or return incorrect results?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::sign_share()] [Medium - Share Malleability] Can a Byzantine validator modify their share after seeing other shares to enable forgery?
